rComments: Most people had the comments about him having an accent and stuff, but he's the only prof that I had in uoft that tried so hard to make you understand the material and teach the content from scratch. I took his course two years ago and attended lectures and just wrote down what he wrote on the board. I wish other profs were as caring as he is
He's a rude professor if you come to his office hours
A very friendly and hilarious Prof who is passionate about math. He encourages student to answer questions during lecture and will gives out bonus mark for your final grade
Amazing professor. I guarantee you that his passion isn't matched by anyone else in the university. He loves math and loves teaching it, best class I took in first year by far.

His is a great professor, he explain everything clearly. If you really want to learn something in his class, you gotta be sitting in the first three rows and get your mind engaged with him while he is teaching. He not only explain how to integrate but also the intuition behind it.

He is a responsible teacher. He gives review session before final. BUT, he is also very rude. He shows no patient when you ask him question. He gives extremely hard final tests. Totally different difficult level with the previous years while he was not course coordinator. I suggest not to take mat244 with him unless you want your GPA Rest In Peace.

Made me love mathematics. He gives more examples and would repeat when asked, to make sure the concept is understood. You better attend lectures prepared or else you might be unlucky he may pick on you to explain a concept done in the previous classes. To do excellent in his tests/exams read his lecture notes and make sure you understand.

Prof Niksirat is an interesting man. He obviously loves math and will always answer any questions a student asks. He's a good math teacher, but I found him terrifying. He has a tendency to wander around the class and pick people to answer questions and explain them in front of everyone. He'll walk up the stairs and pick anyone he wants.
final is way too hard.
The final was so hard that it makes me want to become a farmer.
He has a funny accent, he is incredibly hilarious, and constantly engages with his students.

He genuinely cares about his students and takes pride in his teaching. Very enthusiastic and makes me enjoy join to class although it's literally on the other side of campus for me! Accent was difficult to understand at the beginning but after I got used to it he's an amazing prof!
This prof does not show respect to students.
he is just perfect. does a lot of examples and does not let you go until you understand the subject. very funny and engaging.

I was from another session and went to his office hours. After learning that my professor was not him, he did not even want to "waste" time answering questions with my notes and clarifying with the concepts. Ridiculous.

A great math prof makes a huge difference! I loved math up until Algebra II; lectures were boring and my teachers, though kind at soul, seemed condescending. Conversely, MAT135 with Niksirat is like math heaven. The lectures are engaging and focused. Also, I've never met a prof that respects his students as much as they respect him. :)
The best prof I've ever met
best. prof. ever.

Very clear and enthusiastic in his teaching. Really makes you WANT to learn... and I'm not a big fan of math, to say the least. Has a funny accent and kind of jumps around the room because he gets so excited solving questions. Overall just a stand-up guy.

Absolutely amazing professors. For those that found this course hard, it is because Professor Niksirat actually expects you to remember the things you learned in Mat244, ordinary differential equations. For those that says the exam has almost no relations to lecture, it is completely untrue. He pulled questions straight from examples given in class

Seriously the best professor I have ever had. You can tell he really cares about the students, and his passion makes you WANT to learn. It takes a couple lectures to get used to his accent, but it is so worth it. He is so upbeat and inspirational. I have never enjoyed a class more than his. You won't regret taking his class.

Mohammad is sometimes really rude to you during office hours. Puts many high and unreasonable expectations to the class. Thinks we know everything despite having limited learning resources, which is his unhelpful online textbook. Refuses to curve grades when over half of the class failed on midterm. Is also forgetful to students and makes excuses
Greatest Prof i have ever had. Made calculus as fun as i think it could be. He also makes sure everybody understands before he moves on.
A really amazing prof! Teaches extremely well and lectures are easy to understand if you keep up. He seems to really care about the students unlike other profs. Super funny too
He gives great lectures and the summaries always helps. The tests are not so tough though. But it definitely needs a lot practice to get an A.
AMAZING PROF! best mat135/136 prof ever. explain concepts very well and makes sure everyone understands before starting a new concept. 100% recommend taking a class with him
Easily the best professor I had this semester.

He is by far the best prof I've EVER had!  He is an amazing lecturer. Also, he's really funny. He'll make Calculus the most amazing class for you throughout your undergrad. Take any course you can with him!
One of the best professors ever. He is so funny and makes the class so fun.
Made me love Calculus, even though it's not my best subject.
A prof that is very passionate about teaching and really cares about his students. Beware though, the course itself (MAT244) is not easy.

Best prof i had first year. Very funny and full of energy and you get used to his accent in no time. Always answers questions to the best of his ability and you can always visit him and ask him questions. 11/10
the best prof ever.
Sad to not have him teaching me anymore. He is the most fun professor and most interesting guy and cares about every single student.
Reall good for students and patient!

An excellent professor that makes you feel excited to attend lecture. At first I had trouble understanding his accent, but you get used to it quickly. He's very funny but he teaches concepts very thoroughly- you can tell that he cares about not only the material, but you as a student. Every lecture prepares you for the exam as well!

The best math prof ever. he makes the class so active and dynamic and involves students. He also makes sure that students understood the material. His accent is also really funny and helps you remember material.
Great prof! His class are super exciting and funny! He will not mind explaining the topics again and again if you do not understand it. Super passionate about his class and all the students love him!
His accent and writing takes a few days to get used to but hes amazing. He so funny and enthusiastic and he will always take time to explain. Best math prof ever.
a great professor who gives tons of examples to illustrate each formula!
Loved him, first lecture and I couldnt stop smiling! You can see he loves the subject and wants all his students to love it as well
He is simply awesome. His accent takes time to get used to but his countless examples make the material easy to understand. He doesnt care if you stop him to ask questions.
Great professor, really engages the class. Takes a day or so to get used to his accent, but other than that, there's a very good chance you won't find a mathematics professor who is better than him.

Super passionate about math and is really enthusiastic during lecture!  Also will explain pretty much anything you don't understand. He also answers questions and encourages you to ask questions. Passionate about teaching and making students understand why things work the way they do!  A really great professor!
Really energetic prof, always bring full of energy to lecture. you will never fall asleep in his class!
